commented_code:
+name: Run Pytest on UV
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - main
+    paths:
+      - api/**
+      - docker/**
+      - .github/workflows/api-tests.yml
+
+concurrency:
+  group: api-tests-on-uv-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  test:
+    name: API Tests on uv
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    defaults:
+      run:
+        shell: bash
+        # working-directory: ./api
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        python-version:
+          - "3.12"

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+name: Run Pytest on UV
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - main
+    paths:
+      - api/**
+      - docker/**
+      - .github/workflows/api-tests.yml
+
+concurrency:
+  group: api-tests-on-uv-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  test:
+    name: API Tests on uv
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    defaults:
+      run:
+        shell: bash
+        # working-directory: ./api
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        python-version:
+          - "3.12"
discussion_comments.comment_body:
The `requires-python` setting in the pyproject.toml for the dify-api project specifies ">=3.11,<3.13". 

To ensure compatibility across all supported Python versions, it would be ideal to include Python `"3.11"` in the python-version list of the workflow.

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,83 @@
+name: Run Pytest on UV
+
+on:
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - main
+    paths:
+      - api/**
+      - docker/**
+      - .github/workflows/api-tests.yml
+
+concurrency:
+  group: api-tests-on-uv-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  test:
+    name: API Tests on uv
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    defaults:
+      run:
+        shell: bash
+        # working-directory: ./api
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        python-version:
+          - "3.12"
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Hey , thanks for the review.
This PR is intented to show the possible impacts and it's not yet ready for merging as for now, as it is marked as draft status.
Here use the matrix but only `3.12` is to 1. pass the ci for most used python version , especially shipping Python 3.12 in Docker image for most end users; 2. saving ci test resources for this time.

commented_code:
+version: 2
+updates:
+  - package-ecosystem: npm
+    directory: /web
+    schedule:
+      interval: weekly

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,10 @@
+version: 2
+updates:
+  - package-ecosystem: npm
+    directory: /web
+    schedule:
+      interval: weekly
discussion_comments.comment_body:
```suggestion
      interval: monthly
```
I would suggest to lower the interval to `monthly`, as Dify itself is not a upstream package with lower demand for dependency updates especially for the frontend module.
